name: The PMDS Market System
description: Top-level node representing the PMDS Market System.

children.name: System Users
children.description: Defines various users interacting with PMDS.

children.name: Market Manager (PGL)
children.description: Individuals involved in managing the market operations under PGL.

children.name: PGL staff
children.description: Core staff members managing daily tasks and logistics.

children.name: PGL volunteers
children.description: Volunteers assisting in various operational roles at the market.

children.name: PGL leadership (Germaine and Brittany)
children.description: Senior leaders providing oversight and strategic direction.

children.name: Market Vendors (all)
children.description: All vendors who participate and sell goods/services at the market.

children.name: Farmers
children.description: Vendors who grow and sell fresh produce.

children.name: Value-added producers
children.description: Vendors offering processed or packaged agricultural goods.

children.name: Hot food vendors
children.description: Vendors selling prepared and ready-to-eat meals.

children.name: Educators
children.description: Individuals or groups providing educational content at the market.

children.name: Entertainers
children.description: Artists and performers contributing to the marketâ€™s atmosphere.

children.name: Market Funders
children.description: Entities providing financial and strategic support for the market.

children.name: REACH
children.description: Funds initiatives related to health equity and food access.

children.name: Wallace Clinic
children.description: Supports health and community wellness through funding.

children.name: Outgrowing Hunger/Oregon Food Bank
children.description: Provides resources and funding to address food insecurity.

children.name: Oregon Department of Agriculture
children.description: Supports agricultural development and regulatory oversight.

children.name: System Components
children.description: Breakdown of major technical and operational components of PMDS.

children.name: Data input forms
children.description: Forms used to collect, submit, and manage data from vendors, managers, and attendees.

children.name: Database
children.description: Centralized repository where all market-related data (users, vendors, transactions) is stored and retrieved.

children.name: Unique IDs
children.description: ID system (e.g., Vendor ID, Neighbor ID) used for linking data entries to specific stakeholders.

children.name: Mobile Wallet
children.description: A digital solution that facilitates benefit tracking and transactions at the market.

children.name: For all market attendees
children.description: Mobile Wallet is accessible to all individuals attending the market.

children.name: New Attendees to the Market
children.description: Attendees who are participating in the market for the first time.

children.name: Return Attendees to the Market
children.description: Individuals who have previously attended the market.

children.name: Unregistered attendees
children.description: Attendees who have not formally registered through the system.

children.name: Tracks balances of all benefits by attendee family (Neighbor ID):
children.description: Allows tracking of different benefit balances linked to family Neighbor ID.

children.name: SNAP Bucks
children.description: Manually loaded for SNAP recipients who present their SNAP card and determine how much they want to spend; determines token allocation.

children.name: Wallace Bucks
children.description: Autoloaded ($25) for designated Wallace clients.

children.name: Community Bucks
children.description: Manually loaded for first 200 people to attend the market and receive the physical bucks while in line at the registration table.

children.name: PGL Bucks
children.description: Manually loaded for those who bring physical PGL Bucks to the Market.

children.name: Enables transactions with all vendors
children.description: Supports various types of financial exchanges between attendees and vendors.

children.name: Benefits based transactions
children.description: Transactions completed using market benefits such as SNAP, Wallace, or Community Bucks.

children.name: Non-benefits based transactions (cash and/or card only)
children.description: Transactions conducted using cash, credit, or debit cards outside the benefit system.

children.name: Benefits and Non-benefits based transactions combined
children.description: Transactions involving both benefit tokens and cash/card payments together.

children.name: Invoicing and remittance
children.description: Automates vendor payment tracking and enables funder invoicing tied to benefit usage.

children.name: Dashboards
children.description: Visual analytics and report interfaces for various user groups.

children.name: Shared Dashboard Set
children.description: Dashboards shared across users for general reporting and status overview.

children.name: Benefit Utilization Dashboard
children.description: Displays data on how benefits such as SNAP are being utilized across the market.

children.name: Market Attendance Dashboard
children.description: Visualizes attendance patterns of various market participants over time.

children.name: General Dashboard
children.description: A summary view with key metrics for overall market performance.

children.name: Invoice and Remittance Dashboard
children.description: Tracks invoices submitted and payments made to vendors and funders.

children.name: Market Sales Dashboard
children.description: Breaks down sales figures by vendor, product type, and payment method.

children.name: Vendor Information Dashboard
children.description: Displays contact, participation, and history information for vendors.

children.name:
Contract Dashboard Set
(forthcoming)
children.description: Dashboards specific to contract performance and metrics reporting.

children.name: Funder Invoice and Remittance Dashboard
children.description: Tracks funder-specific invoicing and remittance activities.

children.name: REACH-PGL Contract Dashboard
children.description: Monitors contract milestones, deliverables, and metrics for REACH and PGL.

children.name: CSA Dashboard
children.description: Tracks participation and distribution metrics for the Community Supported Agriculture program.

children.name:
Vendor Dashboard Set
(forthcoming)
children.description: Dashboards tailored for vendor-facing metrics and internal PGL tracking needs.

children.name: Item Sales Dashboard
children.description: Tracks quantity and type of items sold by vendors at each market.

children.name: PGL Personnel Dashboard
children.description: Displays information about PGL staff assignments, hours, and roles per market day.

children.name: All PGL Contracts Dashboard
children.description: Aggregates and tracks all contracts PGL is involved in across different programs and funders.

children.name: Inventory Dashboard
children.description: Monitors current inventory levels and supply chain status for vendor goods.

children.name: Core Functionalities
children.description: Other core functionalities for usage

children.name: Mobile App Interfaces
children.description: for easy Vendor and Attendee information access

children.name: For vendors
children.description: Vendor-specific views and tools for mobile interaction.

children.name: Vendor ID
children.description: Unique identifier for each vendor used across forms and dashboards.

children.name: Website link for quick access to forms and dashboards
children.description: Direct link provided in the app to access required forms and performance dashboards.

children.name: For attendees
children.description: Personalized mobile views for attendees and benefit tracking.

children.name: Neighbor ID
children.description: Unique family ID used to link benefit balances and transactions.

children.name: Neighbor PIN
children.description: A secure PIN used for transaction authorization at the market.

children.name: First and last name and DOB of all family members on the account
children.description: Personal details for identity verification and account-level tracking.

children.name: CSA member or not
children.description: Indicates whether the attendee is currently enrolled in CSA distribution.

children.name: Wallace member or not
children.description: Flags if the attendee is eligible for Wallace Bucks auto-load benefits.

children.name: Notifications
children.description: Supports communication alerts and reminders for users of the system.

children.name: PGL
children.description: Notifications targeted at market managers and administrative staff.

children.name: Three or more consecutive market attendance days below monthly average
children.description: Email

children.name: Three or more consecutive market sales days below monthly average (any payment type)
children.description: Email

children.name: Rental equipment returned damaged or not returned

children.name: CSA drop (if any enrolled CSA member misses 2 consecutive CSA pick-ups)

children.name: New vendor application submitted through vendor request form

children.name: New vendor documents uploaded through vendor document upload form
children.description: Email

children.name: If vendor has any missing forms from the document upload form (beginning 3 days after due)
children.description: Email

children.name: CSA cap reached
children.description: Email and portal notification

children.name: Vendor
children.description: Notifications related to participation, transactions, or schedules.

children.description: Email

children.name: Rental equipment returned damaged or not returned
children.description: Email

children.name: If vendor has any missing forms from the document upload form (beginning 3 days after due)
children.description: Email

children.name: Funder
children.description: Updates on reports, invoices, or funding milestones.

children.name: Three or more consecutive market attendance days below monthly average
children.description: Email

children.name: Three or more consecutive market sales days below monthly average (any payment type)
children.description: Email

children.name: Vendor has â‰¥1 overdue document (starts 1 week post due, repeats every 3 days)
children.description: Email

children.name: Low expected attendance (<50% vendors) for next market
children.description: Email

children.name: System maintenance down / in progress
children.description: Email

children.name: Encryption
children.description: All sensitive data is encrypted both in transit and at rest to ensure privacy and regulatory compliance.

children.name: Access restriction
children.description: Granular access control ensures only authorized users can view or edit specific information.

children.name: Real-time updates
children.description: Changes in forms, dashboards, or mobile entries are reflected in real-time across the system.

children.name: Back-end time stamps
children.description: Every submission or update is automatically time-stamped for auditability.

children.name: Document uploading
children.description: Use this for uploading vendor registration related documents in the vendor market , vendor request and the document uploading form

children.name: ID tracking
children.description: Uses unique IDs (Vendor ID, Neighbor ID) to link all actions, submissions, and benefits to correct stakeholders.

children.name: The PMDS Support
children.description: Resources to assist users in understanding, navigating, and using PMDS effectively.

children.name: User Guide
children.description: Comprehensive written manual to assist users in understanding and using PMDS.

children.name: End of Market
children.description: End of market form for closure documentation.

children.name: End of Season
children.description: End of season report submission form.
